question:
What is the length of IPv4 address in terms of nibble?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 15/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• An IPv4 address is a unique identifier assigned to each device on a network, used for addressing and routing.
  • It consists of 32 bits divided into 4 octets, each octet containing 8 bits.
  • A nibble is defined as 4 bits, which is exactly half an octet.
  • To find the length of an IPv4 address in terms of nibbles, divide the total bits by bits per nibble:

    32 bits ÷ 4 bits per nibble = 8 nibbles.

  • Thus, an IPv4 address is 8 nibbles long.

Additional Information:

  • Each nibble corresponds to a single hexadecimal digit (0–F), so an IPv4 address can also be represented as 8 hexadecimal digits.
  • For example, the IPv4 address 192.168.0.1 can be written in hexadecimal as C0.A8.00.01, which is 8 nibbles (C0 = 2 nibbles, A8 = 2 nibbles, etc.).
  • Understanding the nibble size is important for tasks like subnetting, IP address manipulation, and understanding network protocols.

question:
Address is a string of numbers consisting of four parts. Where each part is a number between _________ and __________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-II 15/06/2022 (Shift-II)
solution:
• An address (specifically an IPv4 address) consists of four parts called octets.
  • Each part is a number between 0 and 255.
  • Each octet is 8 bits, which allows it to represent 256 values from 0 to 255.
  • These addresses are used in computer networks to identify devices.

Additional Information:

  • IPv4 addresses are written in dot-separated format, e.g., 168.1.1.
  • The maximum value for each part is 255, since binary 11111111 equals decimal 255.
  • The value 0 can represent the network or indicate no value in that segment.
  • The entire address is 32 bits, divided into four 8-bit parts.

question:
Which of the following does NOT support bidirectional data transmission?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 15/06/2022 (Shift-II)
option_4: Both Half-duplex and Full-duplex
solution:
• Bidirectional data transmission means data can flow in both directions between devices.
  • Full-duplex supports simultaneous two-way communication (both directions at the same time).
  • Half-duplex supports two-way communication but only one direction at a time.
  • Simplex supports data flow in only one direction, so it does NOT support bidirectional transmission.

Additional Information:

  • In Simplex mode, communication is one-way, like a keyboard to a computer.
  • Full-duplex is used in telephone networks where both parties talk and listen simultaneously.
  • Half-duplex is used in walkie-talkies where users take turns to speak.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is (c) Simplex.

question:
In which of the following network topologies do the connected components make a closed loop?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 17/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A network topology describes the arrangement of different nodes (devices) in a network.
  • In a ring topology, each node is connected to exactly two other nodes, forming a closed loop or circle.
  • This loop allows data to travel in one or both directions around the ring.
  • Other topologies like tree, star, and bus do not form a closed loop.

Additional Information:

  • In tree topology, nodes are connected in a hierarchy without any loops.
  • In star topology, all nodes connect to a central node (hub), no loops.
  • In bus topology, all nodes are connected to a single communication line (bus), also no closed loop.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Ring topology.

question:
Which of the following is not a version of Android mobile operating system?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/07/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Android mobile operating system versions are named mostly after sweets and desserts.
  • Common Android versions include Pie, Lollipop, and Marshmallow.
  • Candy Bean is not a version of Android OS.
  • The correct name is “Candy Crush” (a game), but no Android version called Candy Bean exists.

Additional Information:

  • Android versions follow alphabetical order:
    • Lollipop (5.0)
    • Marshmallow (6.0)
    • Nougat (7.0)
    • Oreo (8.0)
    • Pie (9.0)
  • This naming convention helps identify versions easily.
  • Hence, Candy Bean is the odd one out.

question:
_________ enable a user to remotely access another computer and terminals over the Internet.

RRB NTPC Stage-II 21/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Telnet is a protocol that enables a user to remotely access another computer or terminal over the Internet or network.
  • It allows users to log in to a remote machine and execute commands as if they were physically present.
  • FTP is used for file transfer, HTTP is used for web page access, and Use Net is not a correct term here.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Telnet.

Additional Information:

  • Telnet operates on port 23 by default.
  • It is mostly replaced by SSH now due to security concerns, but still used for some remote management.
  • Telnet provides a text-based interface to control remote computers.
  • Unlike HTTP, Telnet is not used for browsing websites.

question:
WAN in the context of computers and networking stands for:

RRB NTPC Stage-II 09/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• WAN stands for Wide Area Network in computers and networking.
  • It is a network that covers a large geographic area, often consisting of multiple smaller networks connected together.
  • Examples of WAN include the Internet and large corporate networks spanning cities or countries.
  • Other options like WiFi Amended Network, Wide Access Network, and World Access Network are incorrect.

Additional Information:

  • WANs are typically used to connect local area networks (LANs) and other networks.
  • WAN technology can include leased lines, satellite links, and public networks.
  • WAN allows communication over long distances.
  • WAN is a fundamental part of global communication infrastructure.

question:
Which of the following is a correct format of an Email address?

RRB JE Stage-II 30/08/2019 (Shift-III)
solution:
• A correct email address format consists of two main parts separated by an @ symbol.
  • The format is: username@domain.extension (e.g., name@website.com).
  • Option (b) follows this correct format.
  • Options (a), (c), and (d) are incorrect because:
    • (a) is a website URL format, not an email address.
    • (c) misses the @ symbol.
    • (d) contains an invalid character # in the domain part.

Additional Information:

  • The username can contain letters, numbers, dots, and some special characters.
  • The domain is usually the website or email service provider.
  • The extension is typically like .com, .org, .net, etc.
  • Email addresses must not contain spaces or invalid characters.

question:
Which of the following is NOT the layer of TCP/IP protocol?

RRB JE Stage-II 30/08/2019 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The TCP/IP protocol suite consists of four main layers:
    1. Application layer
    2. Transport layer
    3. Internet layer
    4. Network Interface layer (sometimes called Link layer)
  • The Presentation layer is part of the OSI model, not the TCP/IP model.
  • Therefore, Presentation layer is NOT a layer of TCP/IP protocol.

Additional Information:

  • TCP/IP model simplifies networking into fewer layers than OSI.
  • The Presentation layer in OSI handles data translation, encryption, and compression.
  • In TCP/IP, these functions are handled within the Application layer.
  • So, correct answer is (a) Presentation layer.

question:
________ is used for transmitting files between computers on the Internet over TCP/IP connections.

RRB JE Stage-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used for transmitting files between computers over the Internet using TCP/IP connections.
  • It allows users to upload, download, and manage files on remote servers.
  • ASCII and BCD are data encoding schemes, not protocols for file transfer.
  • HTTP is used for web page transfer, not specifically for file transfers.

Additional Information:

  • FTP typically uses port 21 for control and port 20 for data transfer.
  • FTP supports authentication with username and password.
  • It is one of the oldest protocols for file transfer over networks.
  • Secure alternatives like SFTP and FTPS are also used today.

question:
Among the following, name the software components of a computer?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 25/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Software components of a computer are the programs and instructions that tell the hardware what to do.
  • Programs are examples of software components.
  • CMOS, CPU, and Memory are all hardware components.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is (c) Programs.

Additional Information:

  • Software includes operating systems, application software, utilities, and programming languages.
  • Hardware refers to physical parts like processor (CPU), memory chips, and storage devices.
  • Software and hardware work together to perform computer tasks.
  • Understanding the difference helps in troubleshooting and system design.

question:
Communication between a computer and a keyboard involves ________ transmission.

RRB JE CBT-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Communication between a computer and a keyboard is an example of simplex transmission.
  • In simplex transmission, data flows in only one direction — from the keyboard to the computer.
  • The keyboard only sends data, it does not receive any data from the computer.
  • Full-duplex and half-duplex allow two-way communication, which is not the case here.

Additional Information:

  • Simplex transmission is common in devices like keyboards, mice, and microphones.
  • Full-duplex allows simultaneous two-way communication, e.g., telephone.
  • Half-duplex allows two-way communication but only one direction at a time, e.g., walkie-talkie.
  • Understanding transmission types is important in network and device communication.

question:
For which purpose India’s fastest and the first multi-PetaFlops (OF) supercomputer ‘Pratyush’ used.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• India’s supercomputer ‘Pratyush’ is primarily used for weather forecasting.
  • It helps in predicting weather patterns, cyclones, and climate modeling with high accuracy.
  • It is one of the fastest multi-PetaFlops supercomputers in India dedicated to meteorological studies.
  • Other options like pharmaceutical development, seismic data analysis, and scientific data processing are important but not the primary purpose of Pratyush.

Additional Information:

  • Pratyush was developed by the Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM).
  • It plays a critical role in disaster management by providing early warnings.
  • It supports climate change research and environmental monitoring.
  • Accurate weather forecasting aids agriculture, aviation, and other sectors.

question:
The internet works by using a protocol called TCP/IP. What is the full form of TCP/IP.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/01/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol
option_2: Tele Computer Protocol/Internet Protocol
option_3: Temporary Computer Protocol/Internet Protocol
option_4: Transmission Computer Programme/Internet Protocol
solution:
• The Internet works using the TCP/IP protocol suite.
  • The full form of TCP/IP is Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol.
  • TCP/IP is a set of communication protocols used to interconnect network devices on the internet.
  • Other options are incorrect and do not represent the actual full form.

Additional Information:

  • Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) ensures reliable data transmission between devices.
  • Internet Protocol (IP) handles addressing and routing of data packets.
  • TCP/IP is the fundamental protocol for the functioning of the Internet.
  • It was developed in the 1970s and is still widely used today.

question:
Which of the following protocols is used for WWW?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The protocol used for World Wide Web (WWW) is HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol).
  • HTTP defines how messages are formatted and transmitted, and how web servers and browsers should respond.
  • Other protocols:
    • FTP is for file transfer.
    • SMTP is for sending emails.
    • TCP/IP is the basic communication protocol suite but not specific to WWW.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) HTTP.

Additional Information:

  • HTTP works over port 80 by default.
  • HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP.
  • Web browsers use HTTP to fetch web pages from servers.
  • HTTP is stateless, meaning each request is independent.

question:
_________ is a communication protocol.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 09/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is a widely used communication protocol on the internet.
  • It governs how messages are formatted and transmitted between web browsers and servers.
  • Options (a) HTP, (b) CP, and (c) TP are incorrect or incomplete abbreviations and do not represent valid communication protocols.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) HTTP.

Additional Information:

  • HTTP operates on port 80 by default.
  • It is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web (WWW).
  • HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, providing encrypted communication.
  • HTTP is a stateless protocol, meaning each request is treated independently.

question:
A shared network within an organisation that enables all its employees to communicate with one another is called:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/07/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A shared network within an organization that allows employees to communicate and share information is called an Intranet.
  • An Intranet is a private network accessible only to an organization's staff.
  • Other options:
    • Extranet extends part of an intranet to authorized external users.
    • Delnet is a document delivery network in India.
    • Internet is a global public network.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Intranet.

Additional Information:

  • Intranet improves communication, collaboration, and information sharing within an organization.
  • It usually uses web technologies like HTTP and browsers internally.
  • Intranets are secured by firewalls to restrict external access.
  • It helps in efficient workflow and resource sharing.

question:
Which of the following is an advantage of LAN?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 23/02/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: Automatic pricing of data
solution:
• One of the main advantages of a Local Area Network (LAN) is sharing peripherals like printers, scanners, and storage devices among multiple computers.
  • This reduces the cost of buying individual devices for each user.
  • Options like automatic pricing of data, saving up data, and backing up data are not direct advantages specific to LAN.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Sharing peripherals.

Additional Information:

  • LAN enables efficient resource utilization within a limited geographic area.
  • It also facilitates communication and data sharing among connected devices.
  • Sharing peripherals improves productivity and reduces hardware costs.
  • LANs are commonly used in offices, schools, and homes.

question:
In the context of computers, the time taken to receive data from a storage device or to obtain data from a peripheral unit is known as ____________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The time taken to receive data from a storage device or to obtain data from a peripheral unit is called Access time.
  • Access time measures the delay between a request for data and the start of data transfer.
  • Other options:
    • Time slicing is a CPU scheduling method.
    • Downtime refers to system or device non-functioning period.
    • Time sharing is a method to share computing resources among users.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Access time.

Additional Information:

  • Access time is a critical performance metric for storage devices like hard drives and SSDs.
  • Lower access time means faster data retrieval.
  • Access time includes seek time, latency, and transfer time.
  • It affects the overall speed of a computer system.

question:
The port that is a protocol for transferring data to and from digital devices is known as:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The USB (Universal Serial Bus) port is a widely used protocol and port for transferring data to and from digital devices.
  • USB supports plug-and-play and hot-swapping features, making it very popular for connecting peripherals like keyboards, mice, printers, and storage devices.
  • Other options:
    • VGA is a video output port.
    • Parallel port is an older port mainly used for printers.
    • PS/2 is used for connecting keyboards and mice but is less common today.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) USB.

Additional Information:

  • USB supports data transfer speeds ranging from USB 1.0 to USB 4.0 standards.
  • It can provide power to connected devices along with data transfer.
  • USB ports have largely replaced older ports like serial and parallel ports.
  • USB is used for data transfer, charging, and connecting various peripherals.

question:
A set of contiguous data of similar type is called:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A set of contiguous data of the same type is called an Array.
  • Arrays store multiple values in a single variable and allow access via indices.
  • Other options:
    • Object is an instance of a class containing data and methods.
    • Class is a blueprint for creating objects.
    • Abstraction is a concept in OOP to hide complex details.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Array.

Additional Information:

  • Arrays improve efficiency by storing data sequentially in memory.
  • They support fast access to elements via index numbers.
  • Arrays can be one-dimensional or multi-dimensional.
  • Understanding arrays is fundamental in programming and data structures.

question:
Walkie-talkie is an example of which communication channel?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A walkie-talkie allows communication in both directions, but only one person can speak at a time.
  • This type of communication is called Half duplex.
  • In Half duplex, data flows both ways but not simultaneously.
  • Other options:
    • Simplex is one-way communication only.
    • Full duplex allows simultaneous two-way communication.
    • Medium duplex is not a standard term.

Additional Information:

  • Walkie-talkies use a push-to-talk button to control transmission.
  • They are commonly used in security, construction, and event management.
  • Half duplex communication is simpler and cheaper than full duplex.
  • Examples include walkie-talkies, CB radios.

question:
Which network needs a ‘hub’ for functioning in a network topology?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-III)
option_4: Both Bus and star
solution:
• A star topology network requires a hub (or switch) to connect all devices centrally.
  • In star topology, all devices are connected to a central hub that manages data traffic.
  • Other topologies:
    • Ring topology connects devices in a closed loop without a hub.
    • Bus topology uses a single communication line without a hub.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Star.

Additional Information:

  • The hub acts as a central point for data transmission and controls network traffic.
  • Star topology is popular due to easy troubleshooting and scalability.
  • Failure of one device doesn’t affect the whole network, but hub failure does.
  • Star topology is widely used in LANs.

question:
Transmission of which of the following network topologies has the highest speed?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-II)
option_4: LAN and WAN have equal transmission speed.
solution:
• Among the options, LAN (Local Area Network) generally has the highest transmission speed.
  • LANs cover a small geographical area like an office or building, allowing faster data transfer.
  • WAN (Wide Area Network) and MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) cover larger areas, so their speeds are typically slower due to distance and infrastructure.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is (a) LAN.

Additional Information:

  • LANs commonly use high-speed technologies like Ethernet and Wi-Fi.
  • WANs often rely on slower connections like leased lines or public networks.
  • MANs connect networks in a city or metropolitan area with moderate speed.
  • Speed differences arise due to distance, network design, and technology used.

question:
Which of the following is an example of a full Duplex communication channel?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• A full duplex communication channel allows data to flow simultaneously in both directions.
  • A telephone conversation is an example where both parties can speak and listen at the same time.
  • Other options:
    • Radio broadcasting and television broadcasting are simplex (one-way) communication.
    • Walkie-talkie is half duplex, allowing communication in both directions but only one at a time.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Telephone conversation.

Additional Information:

  • Full duplex systems improve communication efficiency.
  • They are used in telephony, video conferencing, and many network systems.
  • Understanding duplex modes helps in designing communication systems.
  • Full duplex requires more complex hardware than half duplex.

question:
Which of the following is the largest network in terms of area?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The Internet is the largest network in terms of geographical area.
  • It connects millions of private, public, academic, business, and government networks worldwide.
  • Other options:
    • MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) covers a city or metropolitan area.
    • WAN (Wide Area Network) covers large geographic areas but is smaller than the global Internet.
    • Intranet is a private network within an organization.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Internet.

Additional Information:

  • The Internet enables global communication and information sharing.
  • WANs are subsets of the Internet or independent large networks.
  • MANs and Intranets cover limited areas compared to WAN and Internet.
  • The Internet’s vast scale makes it the largest interconnected network.

question:
Testing of already existing large databases to get new useful information in the context of information technology. The process is called-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2017 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The process of testing already existing large databases to extract new useful information is called Data Mining.
  • Data mining involves analyzing data patterns, trends, and relationships to gain insights.
  • Other options:
    • Simulating means creating a model to imitate real processes.
    • Resourcing refers to obtaining resources.
    • Heaving is not related to data or IT processes.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Mining.

Additional Information:

  • Data mining is widely used in business, science, and technology for decision-making.
  • It employs techniques like clustering, classification, and association rule learning.
  • Helps organizations in predictive analysis and customer behavior understanding.
  • It is an essential part of big data analytics.

question:
TELEX stands for?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2017 (Shift-I)
solution:
• TELEX stands for Teleprinter Exchange.
  • It is a communication system that allows sending text-based messages over long distances using teleprinters.
  • Other options:
    • Telegram express is not correct.
    • Telecommunication exchange and Telephone exchange are different communication systems.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Teleprinter exchange.

Additional Information:

  • TELEX was widely used before the advent of fax and email.
  • It provided a reliable way for businesses and governments to exchange written messages.
  • Messages were typed on teleprinters and transmitted over dedicated lines.
  • TELEX systems played a significant role in early electronic communication.

question:
Netware is a computer network operating system developed by __________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• NetWare is a computer network operating system developed by Novell.
  • It was widely used in the 1980s and 1990s for file and print sharing in local area networks (LANs).
  • Other options:
    • AT&T, Sun Microsystems, and Atari are different companies, not related to NetWare development.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Novell.

Additional Information:

  • NetWare was one of the first popular network operating systems.
  • It provided services like file sharing, printer access, and directory services.
  • Novell played a major role in LAN networking with NetWare.
  • Later, other operating systems like Microsoft Windows Server gained prominence.

question:
Which of the following is not right with the data conversion?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/04/2016 (Shift-III)
option_1: Translation from one version to another version
option_2: Receiving data from a legacy system
option_3: Receiving data from another module
option_4: It can use the standard informed program
solution:
• Data conversion refers to the process of converting data from one format or system to another to ensure compatibility.
  • Options (b), (c), and (d) correctly describe aspects of data conversion.
  • Option (a) — "Translation from one version to another version" — is not accurate in the context of data conversion because data conversion deals with format or system changes, not versions of software or documents.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a).

Additional Information:

  • Data conversion ensures that data from legacy systems or different modules can be used effectively in new systems.
  • Standard programs or tools are often used to automate the conversion process.
  • Proper data conversion is essential for system integration and migration.
  • Misinterpretation of data conversion can lead to errors and data loss.

question:
Accessing secure data in offsite centers on the internet is called-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2017 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Accessing secure data stored in offsite centers over the Internet is called Cloud computing or simply Cloud.
  • Cloud allows users to store and retrieve data on remote servers rather than local machines.
  • Other options:
    • Local Area Network (LAN) is a private network within a limited area.
    • Intranet is a private internal network within an organization.
    • Global Network is a broad term but does not specifically mean accessing offsite secure data.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Cloud.

Additional Information:

  • Cloud services provide scalability, flexibility, and remote accessibility.
  • Examples include Google Drive, Dropbox, and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Cloud computing reduces the need for physical storage devices.
  • Security protocols and encryption are used to protect data on the cloud.

question:
The Asymmetric Digital Subscriber (ADSL) is a technology of-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/04/2016 (Shift-I)
option_2: A wired data communication
solution:
• Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line (ADSL) is a technology for wired data communication.
  • It uses existing copper telephone lines to provide high-speed internet access.
  • It is called asymmetric because the download speed is higher than the upload speed.
  • Other options like wireless data communication, non-radio communication, and satellite communication are incorrect.

Additional Information:

  • ADSL is widely used for residential internet connections.
  • It supports simultaneous voice and data transmission over the same line.
  • It is part of the DSL family of technologies.
  • ADSL enables faster internet without needing new wiring.

question:
What is an IP address?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/03/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: A numerical network label
option_2: A dynamic link between two computers
option_3: A group of networks
option_4: Digitally known to its computer
solution:
• An IP address is a numerical network label assigned to each device connected to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.
  • It uniquely identifies a device on a network, allowing data to be sent and received correctly.
  • Other options do not correctly define an IP address.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) A numerical network label.

Additional Information:

  • IP addresses can be IPv4 (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or IPv6.
  • They are essential for routing information across the internet.
  • IP addresses can be static (fixed) or dynamic (changing).
  • The IP address format helps in organizing and locating devices on a network.

question:
Near field communication (NFC) is based on-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/04/2016 (Shift-III)
option_1: Short distance high frequency wireless communication
option_2: Long distance high frequency wireless communication
option_3: Long distance low frequency wireless communication
option_4: Low distance low frequency wireless communication
solution:
• Near Field Communication (NFC) is based on short distance high frequency wireless communication.
  • NFC operates over a very short range (typically a few centimeters) and uses high-frequency radio waves (13.56 MHz).
  • Other options involving long distance or low frequency are incorrect for NFC.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Short distance high frequency wireless communication.

Additional Information:

  • NFC is commonly used for contactless payments, data exchange, and access control.
  • It enables quick and secure communication between devices in close proximity.
  • NFC technology is built on RFID standards.
  • Its short range ensures privacy and reduces interference.

question:
What is the full form of WLAN?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/04/2016 (Shift-II)
option_1: Wireless Local Area Network
option_2: Wide Local Area Network
option_3: Wind Light Atmospheric Nature
option_4: Wireless Local Area Node
solution:
• The full form of WLAN is Wireless Local Area Network.
  • WLAN allows devices to connect and communicate wirelessly within a limited area such as a home, office, or campus.
  • Other options are incorrect or meaningless in this context.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Wireless Local Area Network.

Additional Information:

  • WLAN uses technologies like Wi-Fi to enable wireless connectivity.
  • It provides mobility and flexibility to users within the network coverage area.
  • WLANs are commonly used in homes, offices, and public places.
  • Security measures like WPA and WPA2 are used to protect WLANs.
